card.name: Alert Shu Infantry
card.property: Vigilance

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Kongming's predecessor helped Liu Bei win the battle of Fancheng by recognizing and defeating Cao Ren's use of the dreaded "Eight Gold Locks" formation.

card.name: Eightfold Maze
card.property: Cast this spell only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step. Destroy target attacking creature.

card.name: Empty City Ruse
card.property: Target opponent skips all combat phases of their next turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Out of time and options, Kongming was forced to bluff at Xicheng. He tricked an army of 150,000 Wei by leaving the city gates open and calmly playing the zither.

card.name: False Defeat
card.property: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "All warfare is based on deception." —Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

card.name: Flanking Troops
card.property: Whenever Flanking Troops attacks, you may tap target creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Following the battle of Redcliffs, both Liu Bei and Sun Quan coveted the province of Jingzhou. After Sun Quan's troops failed to capture it, Liu Bei's succeeded.

card.name: Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.) When Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may shuffle Guan Yu into your library.

card.name: Guan Yu's 1,000-Li March
card.property: Destroy all tapped creatures.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "He Guan Yu covered the ground on a thousand-li horse; / With dragon blade he took each pass by force."

card.name: Huang Zhong, Shu General
card.property: Huang Zhong, Shu General can't be blocked by more than one creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Virile in war, he kept the north in fear; His prodigies subdued the western sphere."

card.name: Kongming, "Sleeping Dragon"
card.property: Other creatures you control get +1/+1.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Such a lord as this—all virtues' height— Had never been, nor ever was again."

card.name: Kongming's Contraptions
card.property: {T}: Kongming's Contraptions deals 2 damage to target attacking creature. Activate this ability only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.

card.name: Liu Bei, Lord of Shu
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.) Liu Bei, Lord of Shu gets +2/+2 as long as you control a permanent named Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior or a permanent named Zhang Fei, Fierce Warrior.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Only wisdom and virtue can truly win men's devotion." —Liu Bei

card.name: Loyal Retainers
card.property: Sacrifice Loyal Retainers: Return target legendary creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

card.name: Misfortune's Gain
card.property: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The mourning families of commanders and generals were often given land, valuables, or money to compensate for their losses.

card.name: Pang Tong, "Young Phoenix"
card.property: {T}: Target creature gets +0/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: ". . . It was Pang Tong's boat-connecting scheme That let Zhou Yu accomplish his great deed."

card.name: Peach Garden Oath
card.property: You gain 2 life for each creature you control.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "We three, though of separate ancestry, join in brotherhood . . . . We dare not hope to be together always but hereby vow to die the selfsame day." —Peach Garden Oath

card.name: Rally the Troops
card.property: Cast this spell only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step. Untap all creatures you control.

card.name: Ravages of War
card.property: Destroy all lands.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Thorn bushes spring up wherever the army has passed. Lean years follow in the wake of a great war." —Lao Tzu, Tao Te Ching (trans. Feng and English)

card.name: Riding Red Hare
card.property: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains horsemanship until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: One of the greatest steeds in the empire, Red Hare could travel a thousand li a day and climb hills as if running on flat ground.

card.name: Shu Cavalry
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: In establishing the Shu kingdom, Liu Bei's forces fought against Ma Chao at Chengdu. Eventually, Ma Chao surrendered and became one of Liu Bei's Tiger Generals.

card.name: Shu Defender
card.property: Whenever Shu Defender blocks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Confronting Cao Cao's army at Steepslope Bridge, Zhang Fei bellowed, "I am Zhang Fei of Yan! Who dares fight me to the death?" Cao Cao's army cowered and fled.

card.name: Shu Elite Companions
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Throughout the three kingdoms, important generals were often guarded by small groups of expert soldiers known as "elite companions."

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Kongming's first campaign against the Wei kingdom was a rousing success until an arrogant Shu general, Ma Su, foolishly lost the city of Jieting.

card.name: Shu Farmer
card.property: {T}: You gain 1 life. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The common folk are ceaselessly active. The fields are fertile and the soil productive, and neither flood nor drought plagues us." —A Shu diplomat

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Liu Bei lost many men at the battle of Runan because of his lack of strategy. It wasn't until he met Kongming that he began to truly succeed as a leader.

card.name: Shu General
card.property: Vigilance; horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

card.name: Shu Grain Caravan
card.property: When Shu Grain Caravan enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Keeping a million-man army fed was no easy task. Grain and rice caravans were the lifeblood of the empire.

card.name: Shu Soldier-Farmers
card.property: When Shu Soldier-Farmers enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: During Kongming's campaigns against the Wei, his Shu troops rotated from the battlefront to the fields every hundred days.

card.name: Vengeance
card.property: Destroy target tapped creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Until I've gnawed their flesh and exterminated their clans, my humiliation will not be effaced." —Liu Bei, on the death of his oath-brother Guan Yu

card.name: Virtuous Charge
card.property: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The empire belongs to no one man but to all in the empire. He who has virtue shall possess it."

property.name: Flavor
property.value: After making the Peach Garden Oath, the three brothers raised an army of 500 youths to fight the Yellow Scarves rebellion.

card.name: Warrior's Stand
card.property: Cast this spell only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step. Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.

card.name: Zhang Fei, Fierce Warrior
card.property: Vigilance; horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Zhang Fei's uncharacteristic alliance with a defeated Riverlands general, Yan Yan, allowed Shu forces to advance through forty-five Riverlands strongpoints with no casualties.

card.name: Zhao Zilong, Tiger General
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.) Whenever Zhao Zilong, Tiger General blocks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Zhao Zilong was a brave and noble warrior. Twice he rescued Liu Bei's son, Liu Shan.

card.name: Balance of Power
card.property: If target opponent has more cards in hand than you, draw cards equal to the difference.

card.name: Borrowing 100,000 Arrows
card.property: Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Kongming and Lu Su tricked Wei troops into shooting over 100,000 arrows at them to later use against the Wei at Red Cliffs.

card.name: Brilliant Plan
card.property: Draw three cards.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: At Red Cliffs, Kongming and Zhou Yu each wrote his plan for defeating the Wei on the palm of his hand. They laughed as they both revealed the same word, "Fire."

card.name: Broken Dam
card.property: Tap one or two target creatures without horsemanship.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Using nature to their advantage, wise Three Kingdoms generals often let dammed rivers loose to destroy their enemies.

card.name: Capture of Jingzhou
card.property: Take an extra turn after this one.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The province of Jingzhou was the fulcrum of the three kingdoms. At separate times it was coveted and controlled by the Wu, the Shu, and the Wei.

card.name: Champion's Victory
card.property: Cast this spell only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step. Return target attacking creature to its owner's hand.

card.name: Council of Advisors
card.property: When Council of Advisors enters the battlefield, draw a card.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Sun Quan's long and successful rule in the years 199 to 251 was due to his ability to choose and foster talented advisors and generals.

card.name: Counterintelligence
card.property: Return one or two target creatures to their owners' hands.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Before the battle of Red Cliffs, a supposedly sleeping Zhou Yu allowed his old friend, a Wei advisor, to steal a planted letter forged as if from Wei's two best admirals.

card.name: Exhaustion
card.property: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during their next untap step.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Starving and worn, Cao Cao escaped from the battle of Red Cliffs with only 27 of his original 800,000 men.

card.name: Extinguish
card.property: Counter target sorcery spell.

card.name: Forced Retreat
card.property: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Leadership, not numbers, determines victory." —A Wu commander, before his 5,000 troops forced 15,000 Wei troops to retreat from Ruxu

card.name: Lady Sun
card.property: {T}: Return Lady Sun and another target creature to their owners' hands. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Sister to Sun Quan and wife to Liu Bei, Lady Sun often felt her loyalty to both tested.

card.name: Lu Meng, Wu General
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: As the Wu chief commander, Lu Meng conquered Shu-held Jingzhou in 219 by disguising soldiers as merchants on boats filled with hiding troops.

card.name: Lu Su, Wu Advisor
card.property: {T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Lu Su served as an intermediary between the Wu and Shu kingdoms until Zhou Yu's death in 210, when he became Wu's supreme commander.

card.name: Lu Xun, Scholar General
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.) Whenever Lu Xun, Scholar General deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.

card.name: Mystic Denial
card.property: Counter target creature or sorcery spell.

card.name: Preemptive Strike
card.property: Counter target creature spell.

card.name: Red Cliffs Armada
card.property: Red Cliffs Armada can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: By the battle of Red Cliffs in the year 208, the Wu kingdom controlled more than 7,000 warships on the Yangtze.

card.name: Sage's Knowledge
card.property: Return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Those who know do not talk. Those who talk do not know." —Lao Tzu, Tao Te Ching (trans. Feng and English)

card.name: Strategic Planning
card.property: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Plans evolved within the tent decide a victory 1,000 li away."

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The overnight appearance of miles of "armed" Wu forts at Guangling frightened a much vaster Wei force into fleeing for their lives.

card.name: Sun Ce, Young Conquerer
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.) When Sun Ce, Young Conquerer enters the battlefield, you may return target creature to its owner's hand.

card.name: Sun Quan, Lord of Wu
card.property: Creatures you control have horsemanship. (They can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "One score and four he reigned, the Southland king: / A dragon coiled, a tiger poised below the mighty Yangtze."

card.name: Wu Admiral
card.property: Wu Admiral gets +1/+1 as long as an opponent controls an Island.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The Wu kingdom's well-trained admirals were integral to the Southlands' victory at Red Cliffs as well as the kingdom's defense.

card.name: Wu Elite Cavalry
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: At the second battle of Ruxu, the brave Wu general Gan Ning raided Cao Cao's camp of 400,000 men with only 100 cavalry. Not a single man or horse was lost.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The first battle of Hefei was Sun Quan's last as a field general. From then on he let his generals command in the field while he directed battle from behind the front lines.

card.name: Wu Light Cavalry
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: A cunning strategist, Cao Ren tricked Zhou Yu by letting him enter Nanjun. Zhou Yu thought he was capturing the city until Cao Ren's arrows rained down upon him.

card.name: Wu Longbowman
card.property: {T}: Wu Longbowman deals 1 damage to any target. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

card.name: Wu Scout
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.) When Wu Scout enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand.

card.name: Wu Spy
card.property: When Wu Spy enters the battlefield, look at the top two cards of target player's library. Put one of them into their graveyard.

card.name: Wu Warship
card.property: Wu Warship can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Both Wu and Wei warships patrolled the Yangtze River, the natural border between the two kingdoms.

card.name: Zhou Yu, Chief Commander
card.property: Zhou Yu, Chief Commander can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "After making me, Zhou Yu, did you have to make Kongming?" —Zhou Yu crying to heaven on his deathbed

card.name: Zhuge Jin, Wu Strategist
card.property: {T}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: When Zhuge Jin proposed the marriage of Guan Yu's daugher and Sun Quan's heir, Guan Yu's arrogant refusal led to disaster.

card.name: Ambition's Cost
card.property: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "When you give offense to heaven, to whom can you pray?" —Cao Cao, quoting Confucius

card.name: Cao Cao, Lord of Wei
card.property: {T}: Target opponent discards two cards. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

card.name: Cao Ren, Wei Commander
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.) When Cao Ren, Wei Commander enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Cao Cao's cousin, Cao Ren was known throughout the three kingdoms as the fiercest of warriors.

card.name: Coercion
card.property: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Though he held the title of prime minister, Cao Cao used the emperor's name to exert his own influence on the empire.

card.name: Corrupt Court Official
card.property: When Corrupt Court Official enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.

card.name: Cunning Advisor
card.property: {T}: Target opponent discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

card.name: Deception
card.property: Target opponent discards two cards.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Believing they wrote the forged letter that had been stolen from Zhou Yu, Cao Cao rashly executed his two best admirals for treason.

card.name: Desperate Charge
card.property: Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Lieutenants dishonored, corpses carted home; The general raises troops again to take revenge."

card.name: Famine
card.property: Famine deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "But it was a year of dearth. People were reduced to eating leaves of jujube trees. Corpses were seen everywhere in the countryside."

card.name: Ghostly Visit
card.property: Destroy target nonblack creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Cao Cao was haunted to death by the ghosts of the empresses and other high courtiers he had murdered.

card.name: Imperial Edict
card.property: Target opponent chooses a creature they control. Destroy that creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Frustrated with Cao Cao's control of the imperial court, Emperor Xian secretly issued an edict condemning him, using his own blood as ink.

card.name: Imperial Seal
card.property: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "If Heaven has placed it in your hands, it means that the throne is destined to be yours."

card.name: Overwhelming Forces
card.property: Destroy all creatures target opponent controls. Draw a card for each creature destroyed this way.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: By the year 208, Cao Cao commanded more than 1,000 experienced generals and a million infantry, cavalry, and naval troops.

card.name: Poison Arrow
card.property: Destroy target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: In ancient China, not wearing armor could be a fatal mistake. Guan Yu, Zhou Yu, Sun Ce, and other heros were struck by poison arrows.

card.name: Return to Battle
card.property: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Swallowing his eye, the valiant Xiahou Dun fought on; / But Cao Cao's vanguard, its commander wounded, could not hold out for long."

card.name: Sima Yi, Wei Field Marshal
card.property: Sima Yi, Wei Field Marshal's power is equal to the number of Swamps you control.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Sima Yi fought for four generations of the Cao family before his own grandson became emperor and united the three kingdoms.

card.name: Stolen Grain
card.property: Stolen Grain deals 5 damage to target opponent or planeswalker. You gain 5 life.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: At the battle of Guandu, Cao Cao defeated Yuan Shao by raiding his grain depot, leaving him with no way to feed his troops.

card.name: Stone Catapult
card.property: {T}: Destroy target tapped nonblack creature. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

card.name: Wei Ambush Force
card.property: Whenever Wei Ambush Force attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The battle of Puyang marked the beginning of the end for Lu Bu. He lost the city—and later his life—to Cao Cao.

card.name: Wei Assassins
card.property: When Wei Assassins enters the battlefield, target opponent chooses a creature they control. Destroy that creature.

card.name: Wei Elite Companions
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Cao Cao was more concerned with capabilities than lineage. He excelled at recruiting and retaining men of talent to serve him.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Wei won the battle of Hefei when Zhang Liao defeated Sun Quan and then foiled a Wu scheme to incite rebellion.

card.name: Wei Night Raiders
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.) Whenever Wei Night Raiders deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card.

card.name: Wei Scout
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: He will win who, prepared himself, waits to take the enemy unprepared." —Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

card.name: Wei Strike Force
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: At the battle of Chang'an, Ma Chao defeated the two generals Cao Cao sent to guard the pass but was forced to flee when Cao Cao's trickery turned his own ally against him.

card.name: Xiahou Dun, the One-Eyed
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.) Sacrifice Xiahou Dun, the One-Eyed: Return target black card from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

card.name: Xun Yu, Wei Advisor
card.property: {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "A splendid talent, admired of all men! His folly lay in serving Cao Cao's power."

card.name: Young Wei Recruits
card.property: Young Wei Recruits can't block.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "To send the common people to war untrained is to throw them away." —Confucius, The Analects (trans. Lau)

card.name: Zhang He, Wei General
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.) Whenever Zhang He, Wei General attacks, each other creature you control gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

card.name: Zhang Liao, Hero of Hefei
card.property: Whenever Zhang Liao, Hero of Hefei deals damage to an opponent, that opponent discards a card.

card.name: Zodiac Pig
card.property: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: ". . . Zhong Hui and Deng Ai next led armies west: / And to the Cao, Han's hills and streams now passed. . . ."

card.name: Zodiac Rat
card.property: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: " . . . Cao Pi, Cao Rui, Fang, Mao, and briefly, Huan— / The Sima took the empire in their turn. . . ."

card.name: Zodiac Snake
card.property: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Thrice Xuande's ardent quest led to Nanyang, / Where Sleeping Dragon unveiled Han's partition: . . ."

card.name: Barbarian General
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Barbarian tribes with their rulers are inferior to Chinese states without them." —Confucius, The Analects (trans. Lau)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Only twenty years after the Sima clan united the empire, invading barbarians divided it again.

card.name: Blaze
card.property: Blaze deals X damage to any target.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Spreading flames illumined cloud and sea: Cao Cao went down; 'twas Zhou Yu's victory."

card.name: Burning Fields
card.property: Burning Fields deals 5 damage to target opponent or planeswalker.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "In raiding and plundering, be like fire, in immovability like a mountain." —Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

card.name: Burning of Xinye
card.property: You destroy four lands you control, then target opponent destroys four lands they control. Then Burning of Xinye deals 4 damage to each creature.

card.name: Control of the Court
card.property: Draw four cards, then discard three cards at random.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Power-hungry eunuchs, the curse of the dynasty, have thrown the masses of the people into the depths of misery."

card.name: Corrupt Eunuchs
card.property: When Corrupt Eunuchs enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature.

card.name: Desert Sandstorm
card.property: Desert Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: While pursuing the remnants of Yuan Shao's forces into the Wuhan Desert, Cao Cao was temporarily turned back by a fierce sandstorm.

card.name: Diaochan, Artful Beauty
card.property: {T}: Destroy target creature of your choice, then destroy target creature of an opponent's choice. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

card.name: Dong Zhou, the Tyrant
card.property: When Dong Zhou, the Tyrant enters the battlefield, target creature an opponent controls deals damage equal to its power to that player.

card.name: Eunuchs' Intrigues
card.property: Target opponent chooses a creature they control. Other creatures they control can't block this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Taking control of powerful court positions one by one, eunuchs eventually brought on the fall of the Han dynasty, leading to the chaos of the Three Kingdoms.

card.name: Fire Ambush
card.property: Fire Ambush deals 3 damage to any target.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "With fire he broke the battle at Bowang . . . . Striking fear deep into Cao Cao's soul, thus Kongming scored a coup at his debut."

card.name: Fire Bowman
card.property: Sacrifice Fire Bowman: It deals 1 damage to any target. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

card.name: Imperial Recruiter
card.property: When Imperial Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for a creature card with power 2 or less, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The empire, long united, must divide, and long divided, must unite."

card.name: Lu Bu, Master-at-Arms
card.property: Haste; horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Dong Zhuo's man, Lu Bu, warrior without peer, / Far surpassed the champions of his sphere."

card.name: Ma Chao, Western Warrior
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.) Whenever Ma Chao, Western Warrior attacks alone, it can't be blocked this combat.

card.name: Mountain Bandit
card.property: Haste

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Penniless and far from home, many former Yellow Scarves and other soldiers became bandits to survive.

card.name: Ravaging Horde
card.property: When Ravaging Horde enters the battlefield, destroy target land.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Upon his return to the capitol after taking soldiers to loot a nearby peaceful town, the prime minister, Dong Zhou, boasted of it as a victory over bandits.

card.name: Relentless Assault
card.property: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: With only 70,000 men under his command at the battle of Guandu, Cao Cao was able to defeat Yuan Shao and his 700,000.

card.name: Renegade Troops
card.property: Haste

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Across the land rebellions seethed and swarmed / As vicious war lords swooped down on all sides."

card.name: Rockslide Ambush
card.property: Rockslide Ambush deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.

card.name: Rolling Earthquake
card.property: Rolling Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without horsemanship and each player.

card.name: Stone Rain
card.property: Destroy target land.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Soldiers often blocked off the steep mountain passes to ambush enemy troops in western and central China.

card.name: Warrior's Oath
card.property: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "If I fail, my head is yours." —Warrior's oath common during the Three Kingdoms period

card.name: Yellow Scarves Cavalry
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.) Yellow Scarves Cavalry can't block.

card.name: Yellow Scarves General
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.) Yellow Scarves General can't block.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Zhang Jue, leader of the Yellow Scarves rebellion, was a Taoist master and tutored his soldiers in those arts.

card.name: Yellow Scarves Troops
card.property: Yellow Scarves Troops can't block.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Over 500,000 commoners followed Zhang Jue, General of Heaven, in his attempt to overthrow the corrupt Han dynasty.

card.name: Yuan Shao, the Indecisive
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.) Each creature you control can't be blocked by more than one creature.

card.name: Yuan Shao's Infantry
card.property: Whenever Yuan Shao's Infantry attacks alone, Yuan Shao's Infantry can't be blocked this combat.

card.name: Zodiac Dog
card.property: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: ". . . Jiang Wei alone still strove with might and main: / Nine times more he fought the north—in vain. . . ."

card.name: Zodiac Dragon
card.property: When Zodiac Dragon is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may return it to your hand.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: ". . . The kingdoms three are now the stuff of dream, / For men to ponder, past all praise or blame."

card.name: Zodiac Goat
card.property: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: ". . . Near death in Baidi, having reigned three years, / Bei sadly placed his son in Kongming's care. . . ."

card.name: Borrowing the East Wind
card.property: Borrowing the East Wind deals X damage to each creature with horsemanship and each player.

card.name: False Mourning
card.property: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Zhou Yu, Sun Ce, and other famous generals feigned their deaths in order to later surprise their opponents.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Fish and bear paws—one can't have both. —Chinese idiom meaning "you can't have it both ways"

card.name: Heavy Fog
card.property: Cast this spell only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by attacking creatures.

card.name: Hua Tuo, Honored Physician
card.property: {T}: Put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

card.name: Hunting Cheetah
card.property: Whenever Hunting Cheetah deals damage to an opponent, you may search your library for a Forest card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

card.name: Lady Zhurong, Warrior Queen
card.property: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "A man, and such a fool! I, a woman, will fight them for you." —Lady Zhurong to her husband Meng Huo, before leading an army against the Shu

card.name: Lone Wolf
card.property: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

card.name: Marshaling the Troops
card.property: Tap any number of untapped creatures you control. You gain 4 life for each creature tapped this way.

card.name: Meng Huo, Barbarian King
card.property: Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The stubborn Meng Huo was captured and released by Kongming seven times before finally surrendering.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Through his allies, Meng Huo commanded several hundred thousand troops composed of cavalry, rattan-armored warriors, infantry, naked men with swords, and wild animals.

card.name: Riding the Dilu Horse
card.property: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains horsemanship. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship. This effect lasts indefinitely.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "All men have their appointed time; that's something no horse can change." —Liu Bei, after being told that the Dilu brings its master ill fortune

card.name: Slashing Tiger
card.property: Whenever Slashing Tiger becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Unless you enter the tiger's lair, you cannot get hold of the tiger's cubs." —Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: While defending their southern borders, both the Wu and Shu kingdoms fought against the barbarians' trained elephants.

card.name: Spoils of Victory
card.property: Search your library for a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, or Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

card.name: Spring of Eternal Peace
card.property: You gain 8 life.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Bathing in this spring could cure ailments of body and mind alike.

card.name: Stalking Tiger
card.property: Stalking Tiger can't be blocked by more than one creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Throughout Chinese history, generals have often been referred to as tigers for their fierceness, strength, and bravery.

card.name: Taoist Hermit
card.property: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Taoists chose to be hermits for many reasons, but all shared one unchanging goal: to follow the Tao.

card.name: Taoist Mystic
card.property: Taoist Mystic can't be blocked by creatures with horsemanship.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: By appearing in places miles apart at the same time, Zuo Ci exhibited the mystic's ability to "shrink the land."

card.name: Taunting Challenge
card.property: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Incensed by their opponents' unrelenting taunts, even wise generals were known to rashly lead their troops into battle—often to disastrous defeats.

card.name: Three Visits
card.property: Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Trying to meet a worthy man in the wrong way is as bad as closing the door on an invited guest." —Mencius, a Chinese philosopher

card.name: Trained Cheetah
card.property: Whenever Trained Cheetah becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "King Mulu's cheetahs came riding on the winds, charging, with fangs bared and claws flexed."

property.name: Flavor
property.value: To taunt a man into action, call him a coward. To insult him beyond forgiveness, call him a jackal.

card.name: Trip Wire
card.property: Destroy target creature with horsemanship.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Trip wire, hooked poles, and sunken pits were commonly used to unhorse riders during the Three Kingdoms period.

card.name: Wielding the Green Dragon
card.property: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Named for the eastern part of the sky, the source of energy and renewal, Guan Yu's crescent-moon blade weighed over 100 pounds.

card.name: Wolf Pack
card.property: You may have Wolf Pack assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

card.name: Zodiac Horse
card.property: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: ". . . 'First take Jingzhou, next the Riverlands; / On that rich region, base your own royal stand.' . . ."

card.name: Zodiac Monkey
card.property: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: ". . . By six offensives from the hills of Qi Kongming sought to change Han's destiny. . . ."

card.name: Zodiac Ox
card.property: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: ". . . Cao's abdication changed the face of all; / No mighty battles marked the Southland's fall. . . ."

card.name: Zodiac Rabbit
card.property: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: ". . . The world's affairs rush on, an endless stream; / A sky-told fate, infinite in reach, dooms all. . . ."

card.name: Zodiac Rooster
card.property: Plainswalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Plains.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: ". . . But the time of Han had run—could he Kongming not tell?— / That night his master star fell past the hills. . . ."

card.name: Zodiac Tiger
card.property: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: ". . . Three kings no more—Chenliu, Guiming, Anle. / The fiefs and posts must now be filled anew. . . ."

card.name: Zuo Ci, the Mocking Sage
card.property: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.) Zuo Ci, the Mocking Sage can't be blocked by creatures with horsemanship.
